title: 9.4.2 fresh install and selecting Notifications during Onboarding
9.4.0 auto-update to 9.4.2 receiving DSS Notification with existing enabled Notification Settings
Disabling Notifications from 9.4.0 to 9.4.2
custom_preconds: Given an older version of MLB app is installed
custom_steps:
When the user turns off any of the default TEAM notification settings
and then upgrades to a newer MLB app version
custom_expected: Then those team settings should be turned off in notification settings in the newer MLB app version

title: Disabling Default Team Notifications from 9.4.0 to 9.4.2
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an Android device
custom_steps: When a user is on the Notification screen and disables or enables default notifications
custom_expected: Then all notifications will enter the state of the item chosen

title: 9.4.0 auto-update to 9.4.2 in airplane mode
custom_steps:
1.  Upgrade App to latest version
2.  Turn on Airplane Mode
3.  Launch App
custom_expected: App Launches

title: Upgrade app and do NOT open the app
custom_preconds:
Given an older version of MLB app (9.4.0 or older) is installed
And user has notifications enabled
custom_steps:
When use upgrades the app to 9.4.2
AND leaves the app closed
custom_expected:
Then user receives DSS notifications before the app is opened (note that DSS notifications never include thumbnails)
AND the notifications line up with the preferences chosen in the previous version of the app

title: Upgrade app and open MLB app from app icon
custom_preconds:
Given an older version of MLB app (9.4.0 or older) is installed
And user has notifications enabled
custom_steps:
When use upgrades the app to 9.4.2
AND opens the app from the app icon
custom_expected:
Then user receives One Signal notifications after the app is opened (note that One Signal notifications sometimes include thumbnails)
AND the notifications line up with the preferences chosen in the previous version of the app

title: Upgrade with device notifications turned off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has version 9.4.0 or earlier installed on their Android device
AND the user has notifications turned off on their device

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user upgrades to 9.4.2
AND opens the app
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user's device is registered with OneSignal
AND the user does NOT receive notifications

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the upgraded user turns notifications for their device ON
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user receives OneSignal notifications

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user completes the other steps starting from 9.4.1 instead of 9.4.0
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the results are the same as the 9.4.0 upgrade path

title: Upgrade for existing OneSignal registered user
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user that is already registered with OneSignal (because they have version 9.4.1 or later)
AND notifications are turned on for the app
custom_steps: WHEN the user upgrades to the latest version of the app
custom_expected:
THEN the user receives notifications through OneSignal before the app is opened
AND the user receives notifications through OneSignal after the app is opened

title: Favorite Team
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an Android device
custom_steps:
When the user opens the MLB app
and selects a Favorite Team
and navs to app Settings > Notifications
custom_expected:
Then the Favorite Team will be listed after the MLB News
and the rest of the Teams will be listed in alphabetical order

title: Lite User
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an Android device
custom_steps: When a Lite User goes into the app settings and taps on Notifications
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the Push Notifications screen and they can enable and disable any and all notifications

title: Paid User
custom_preconds: Given the MLB app is installed on an Android device
custom_steps:
When a user opens the MLB app
and logs in with Paid Account
and navs to the app Settings > Notifications
custom_expected: Then the user is taken to the Push Notifications screen and they can enable and disable any and all notifications

title: Game Start
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an Android device
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps:
When a user receives a Game Start notification
and presses the notification
custom_expected: Then the app opens to Gameday

title: Lead Change
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an Android device
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Lead Change notification
custom_expected: Then the user will see the lead change information

title: Game End
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an Android device
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Game End notification
custom_expected: Then the user will see the game wrap information.

title: Pitching Change
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an Android device
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Pitching Change notification
custom_expected:
Then the user will see the pitching change information.

Example:

Title: Red Sox Pitching Change
Subtitle: None
Body: Brad Ziegler (3.15 ERA) relieves Rick Porcello (8.1 IP, 103 pitches) in the 9th. The Red Sox lead the Yankees, 4-2.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the notification
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app will open to Gameday for the appropriate game

title: In-Game Video Highlights
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to In-Game highlights for a team
custom_steps: When a notification for in Game Highlight for the specified team is sent
custom_expected: Then the user receives the notification

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the notifcation
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the highlight plays in the app

title: Team News
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an Android device
and has the MLB installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps:
When a user receives a Team News notification
and presses the notification
custom_expected: Then the user will see the related news item

title: Condensed Game
custom_preconds:
Given a user is an Android device
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives a Condensed Game notification

title: MLB News - Native Article
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to MLB News push notifications
custom_steps:
When the user receives an MLB News push notification of an article that is in the MLB News Index
and taps to launch it
custom_expected: Then the news article should launch natively in the MLB News Index

title: MLB News - Webview
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to MLB News push notifications
custom_steps:
When the user receives an MLB News push notification of an article with only a URL, that is not in the MLB News Index
and taps to launch it while the MLB app is backgrounded
custom_expected: Then the news article should launch in a webview on top of the MLB News Index

title: MLB News - Fallback to webview
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to MLB News push notifications
custom_steps: When the user receives an MLB News push notification
custom_expected: Then the news article should launch in a webview on top of the MLB News Index

title: Team News - Native Article
custom_preconds:
Given a user is on an iPhone
and has the MLB app installed
and notifications enabled
custom_steps: When a user receives an Team News notification
custom_expected:
Then the user will see Team News then the editorial content
and team logo

Example:

Title: {teamName} News
Body: {editorial content}

title: MLB News - Native Video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the MLB app 9.4.1 is installed
GIVEN the App splash screen has run
GIVEN User is subscribed to MLB News push notifications
custom_steps:
When the user receives an MLB News push notification of a video that is in the MLB Video Index
and taps to launch it while the MLB app is not running in the background, and has been killed
custom_expected: Then the video should launch natively in the MLB Video Index

title: MLB News - Webview w/Video
custom_preconds:
Given the MLB app is installed
and the user is subscribed to a Team's News push notifications
custom_steps:
When the user receives a Team's News push notification of a native video that is no longer in the team's Video Index
and taps to launch it while the MLB app is backgrounded
custom_expected: Then the video should launch
